subject: Data
title: The Texas Sharpshooter Fallacy
description: A fast breakdown of The Texas Sharpshooter Fallacy for builders.

hook.text: A Texan fires at a barn, then paints a bullseye around the tightest cluster of bullet holes. Perfect aim!

buildup.text: The Texas Sharpshooter Fallacy is finding a pattern in random data and claiming you predicted it.

discovery.text: With enough data points, clusters always appear by chance. Finding them after the fact proves nothing.

twist.text: Cancer cluster investigations often fall into this trap â€” any map of random points will have clusters.

climax.text: The fallacy is why scientists must state their hypothesis before looking at data, not after.

punchline.text: Paint the target first. Then shoot.

quiz.question: What is the Texas Sharpshooter Fallacy?
options: Finding patterns in random data after the fact and claiming prediction
Using Texas as a data sample
